intro: Navia plowmanii, commonly known as the Plover's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Navia plowmanii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological restoration efforts.
